title: Gustave Caillebotte Paris Street, Rainy Day Poster
description:
Poster developed from Gustave Caillebotte’s Paris Street, Rainy Day, 1877, from The Art Institute of Chicago’s collection.

This complex intersection, just minutes away from the Saint-Lazare train station, represents in microcosm the changing urban milieu of late nineteenth-century Paris. Gustave Caillebotte grew up near this district when it was a relatively unsettled hill with narrow, crooked streets. Caillebotte strikingly captured a vast, stark modernity, complete with life-size figures strolling in the foreground and wearing the latest fashions.

  • Dimensions: 26 x 32 in.
  • Material: Premium Cardstock
